sense.name: the removal of liquid, especially water, from an area
sense.examples: Environmentalists were protesting the proposed drain of the wetland. Uplifting of the land over millennia caused a gradual drain of the inland sea.

sense.name: a small surgical tube to remove bodily fluids
sense.examples: The doctor inserted drains in the child's ears to help against chronic ear infections. The patient had a drain inserted in the throat during the surgery.

sense.name: plumbing pipes that transport liquid away
sense.examples: The drain under the kitchen sink was clogged. Leaves and other debris were washed down the storm drains. The odor was caused by a crack in one of the town's sewer drains.

sense.name: the gradual depletion of a resource
sense.examples: The home renovations have been a big drain on John's pocketbook. All these new projects are a serious drain on the state's budget. The opportunities overseas have led to a drain of engineering talent locally. The candidate warned the current drain on natural resources was not sustainable.

sense.name: a complete lack of success
sense.examples: All their efforts to keep the treaty alive went down the drain. His acting career went down the drain after that fiasco of a movie.
